fungicides.name: Chlorothalonil
fungicides.description: Broad-spectrum fungicide used against many fungal leaf spots, blights, and mildews.

fungicides.name: Azoxystrobin (Strobilurins)
fungicides.description: Systemic fungicide with broad activity, common for early blights, Septoria, rusts, and some mildew diseases.

fungicides.name: Copper-based fungicides
fungicides.description: Used against fungal diseases and some oomycetes, also effective against bacterial diseases.

fungicides.name: Sulfur-based fungicides
fungicides.description: Traditional treatment effective against powdery mildews and mite control.

fungicides.name: Metalaxyl / Mefenoxam
fungicides.description: Systemic fungicides specific for oomycetes (water molds).

safety_guidelines: Always wear protective clothing including gloves, masks, and eye protection when handling fungicides.
Avoid inhaling spray mist and ensure good ventilation during application.
Do not apply fungicides near water sources to prevent contamination.
Follow the manufacturer's recommended dosage and application intervals strictly.
Wash hands and exposed skin thoroughly after handling fungicides.
Store fungicides in a secure, cool, dry place away from children and pets.
Dispose of empty containers safely according to local regulations.
Avoid applying fungicides during windy conditions to reduce drift.
Do not consume food or drink during fungicide application.

organic_treatments.description: A natural pesticide and fungicide that controls a wide range of fungal diseases and pests.
Sodium bicarbonate sprays can help reduce fungal growth on leaves by altering surface pH.
Liquid extracts from compost that contain beneficial microbes helping suppress pathogens.
Natural antifungal properties that can reduce fungal spore germination and spread.
Approved for organic farming, copper compounds can be used in limited amounts.
